body.p: To his Excellency the Gov. of Ky your petitioners, would most respectfuly represent that one Isham Woddle was trid at the present Nov. Term of the Larue Circuit on a charge of Laceny. and was convicted, & sent to the Penitentiay for one year.

Your petitioners would represent that ^he^ is a youth of but Seventeen years, and was turned out from his house by a drunken father at about the age of twelve years to Seak a living, and a mother of course, has been thrown into bad company often, and being pinched by hunger & want who in an evil hour appropiated some goods to his own use for which he has been convicted, It is though by many that if he should meete with executive clemancy. there yet may be a chance of reformation, and he be saved, your petitioner think him a fit subject boy that should demand the interposition of the executive clemency and in duty bound they will ever pray &C

T. J. Brunk
John C Nicholas
